intro: Iskandera, commonly known as the "flower of the desert," is a unique plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Eremosparton, which is characterized by its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments. The plant features small, pale yellow flowers that bloom during the brief rainy season, showcasing a delicate beauty adapted to its extreme habitat. Its leaves are typically small and covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Iskandera plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local wildlife.
